content: Aliens are ineligible for visas and excluded from admission for nonpayment of child support. The amendment applies to visas issued on or after 180 days after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 2. REMOVAL OF ALIENS FOR NONPAYMENT OF CHILD SUPPORT. Aliens can be deported for failing to pay child support as legally required under a judgment, decree, or order, with an arrearage exceeding $5,000. Aliens failing to pay child support exceeding $5,000 can be deported until payments are made or a payment agreement is met. The amendment will take effect 180 days after the enactment of the Act. Aliens can be deported for nonpayment of child support exceeding $5,000. Section 318 of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to prevent naturalization for individuals with outstanding child support payments. This amendment applies to naturalization applications filed 180 days after the enactment of the Act. Authorization to serve legal process in child support cases on certain arriving aliens. Immigration officers are authorized to serve legal process in child support cases on arriving aliens applying for admission to the United States, in accordance with State law. Immigration officers can serve legal process on arriving aliens applying for admission to the United States regarding child support cases, as authorized by State law. Legal process includes writs, orders, summons, or similar processes issued by a court or administrative agency. The term 'legal process' refers to any writ, order, summons, or similar process issued by a court or administrative agency in any State, territory, or possession of the United States. The amendment made by this section will apply. The amendment made by this section will apply to aliens applying for admission to the United States on or after 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act. The amendment allows the Immigration and Naturalization Service to request information on delinquent child support payments from the Secretary, aiding in determining if an alien is behind on child support.
